channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Microsoft's AI Dreams Make for an Expensive Reality
item.description: Blowout capital spending as the company’s cloud growth disappoints won’t hearten investors.

item.title: HSBC shares rise 3% after profit beat, $3 billion buyback announcement
item.description: HSBC posted a narrow decline in pretax profit in the first half of the year, but beat expectations on the back of a high-interest rate environment.

item.title: HSBC Quarterly Profit Drops, Plans $3 Billion Buyback
item.description: The London-based bank said net profit declined 3.6% from a year earlier but it still beat consensus estimates.

item.title: Starbucks' turnaround takes an encouraging step forward. Here's what we want to see next
item.description: Starbucks has a long way to go in its turnaround, but Tuesday night's better-than-feared results are an encouraging step forward.

item.title: Big Tech Stocks Keep Falling Ahead of Earnings Deluge, Fed Meeting
item.description: Meta Platforms, Amazon and Apple will report in the coming days.

item.title: AMD jumps on earnings report that validates our decision to reinvest in the stock
item.description: AMD shares are getting a much-needed lift after the chipmaker upped the forecast for its AI business.

item.title: How We Are Trying to Increase the Odds of Having a Healthy Retirement
item.description: Deterioration in our bodies is inevitable. But there are things we’re doing that, we hope, will keep us healthier longer.

item.title: We're upgrading Microsoft after earnings. The stock has pulled back enough lately
item.description: We were so close to having an encore of the picture-perfect results we got in Microsoft's prior quarter.

item.title: Gas or Electric? Splitting the Difference Could Energize Chinese Automakers
item.description: Range anxiety is bad for battery demand but good news for Chinese PHEV makers.

item.title: Microsoft shares drop as cloud miss overshadows better-than-expected revenue and earnings
item.description: Microsoft said it was still supply-constrained for delivering artificial intelligence services to cloud clients. But executives called for cloud acceleration.
